statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Michael Jordan had 28 points and eight assists Friday night as the Washington Wizards survived a fourth-quarter rally to beat Atlanta 97-90, handing the Hawks their sixth straight loss.
article.headline: Wizards earn first-ever season sweep of Hawks

images.name: Jordan, Michael 020201 inline
images.caption: Michael Jordan had eight assists to go with his 28 points Friday.

article.linkText: MJ powers Wiz to season sweep over Hawks
article.story:
WASHINGTON (AP) -- A case of the flu, a suspension and a healing groin injury altered the dynamic of Michael Jordan's supporting cast, yet the Washington Wizards found a way to keep winning. With Hubert Davis, Jahidi White and Richard Hamilton either out or on the mend, Eton Thomas, Courtney Alexander, Brendan Haywood and Tyrone Nesby all had season-highlight games as the Wizards beat the Atlanta Hawks 97-90 Friday night. One night after he made the winning shot in an emotional victory at Cleveland, Jordan had 28 points and eight assists in 38 minutes. Thomas, a rookie, had career highs in points (9), rebounds (10) and minutes (24). Alexander, starting in place of Davis (flu) and Hamilton (groin), had 14 points and a season-high five assists. Haywood, getting his first career start because of White's one-game suspension, had three blocks. Nesby, a gutsy role player all season, scored a season-high 12 points on 4-for-4 shooting and played credible defense on Shareef Abdur-Rahim. "They have been waiting their turn," Jordan said, "waiting for when they can get on the court and show they deserve to be on this team. ET's the one we've been waiting for the most. Eton stepped in and gave us some great minutes. The key guy was Nesby. He played Shareef pretty well." The Wizards took the lead for good four minutes into the game and were up by 14 in the second quarter, but they were never able to put the Hawks away. Atlanta cut into an 11-point lead in the fourth quarter, prompting Jordan to remind his teammates during a timeout that "Winning is hard, losing is easy, so we're going to win." "It's one of the those games where you've just got to gut it out," Jordan said. "You move up. You take a step in the right direction. If we lost the game tonight, it negates what we did last night. Even though we were tired, we had to gut ourselves through this." The lead was down to one with less than three minutes to play, but a crucial turnover by Jason Terry, who stepped on the baseline trying to drive, led to a jump shot by Chris Whitney that restored a five-point lead with 1:10 to go. Jordan shot 10-of-24 from the field and 8-of-10 on free throws in 38 minutes as the Wizards won for the fourth time in five games. Jordan also rejected DerMarr Johnson's fast-break layup some 40 feet into the expensive seats late in the first half. Hamilton, in his second game back from the severe groin injury, scored 10 points off the bench in 24 minutes. Abdur-Rahim scored 25 points and eight rebounds to lead the Hawks, who have dropped 12 of 13 and had lost their previous five games by an average of 21 points. "They're just a little more used to winning right now than we are," Terry said. "When it got down to crunch time and we needed a basket, we didn't get it. They needed one, they got it." The Hawks trailed 78-67 with 10:25 to play, but a pair of 3-pointers each by Terry and Johnson and a baseline dunk by Abdur-Rahim made it 87-86 with 2:50 left. It was 91-88 with less than 1:30 to go when Terry committed his turnover. "Even though it's been rough, I had a lot of fun out there tonight," Terry said. "You can't always say that when you lose. But that's what you've got to get back to: like you're out there on the playground. It's tough right now, but you've got to keep smiling and love the game."

Game notes
The Wizards had a season-low five turnovers. ... White was suspended for one game and fined $7,500 earlier in the day for deliberately head-butting Zydrunas Ilgauskas during Thursday's game at Cleveland. Ilgauskas was fined $5,000, but he wasn't suspended. Cleveland center DeSagana Diop received an automatic one-game suspension without pay and was fined $5,000 for leaving the immediate vicinity of the team bench. ... The Wizards swept the season series from the Hawks (3-0) for the first time since the teams started playing each other in 1961. Atlanta has swept the series four times.
